page.title: 18Local Celebrations.
page.content: The name of Milton Coombe is derived from the existence of a mill that stood in the centre of the village which itself is situated in a steep sided valley, the Devon word for this is coombe, thus Milltown in the Coombe or 'Milton Coombe'. The village enjoys a number of annual celebrations:_ The annual brook race, when local men race on the bed of the brook from the sewage works to the local pub passing under 10 bridges all approximately 1 metre high. At Easter there is an Easter bonnet race. An annual 'Minithon' of six miles. Traditionally on the last day of the year a large proportion of the villagers, who are at home, gather at the pub, the 'Who'd Have Thought It', to welcome in the new year.
